amendment.description: An amendment to prohibit the use of funds appropriated in the bill for the Customs Service to be used to enforce trade policies relating to China when it is known that the effect of that policy would permit into the U.S. Chinese goods which were produced using child or slave labor.

action.text: Mr. Kolbe raised a point of order against the Kaptur amendment (A018). Mr. Kolbe stated that the provisions of the amendment violated clause 5(b) of rule XXI by affecting tariff regulations on a measure not reported from the Committee on Ways and Means. The Chair sustained the point of order.
